page.title: 15Children in Corringham
page.content: Children in Corringham do not really have a lot to do. There is no park but we do have a big playing field, were in summer we play cricket and in winter, football. Sometimes we also play tennis in the school playground. In the winter we go to the youth club, we play table tennis, pool or justlisten to records. Occasionally, they arrange trips to Sheffield,ice skating or a disco. Most days, after tea, we all meet at the school wall, this has been the meeting place for children in Corringham for generations. There is a bus that comes to pick us up for school, in Gainsborough. It picks us up at 8.00 a.m we get to school about 8. 20 a.m. Village life is a lot quieter than in the towns and Corringham is no exception.
